                    ### Question
                    Drug of choice for gonococcal as well as non gonococcal urethritis is

                    ### Options
                    opa. Clindamycin
opb. Cefepime
opc. Metronidazole
opd. Azithromycin

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Azithromycin is the drug of choice for both gonococcal and non-gonococcal urethritis. It is effective against Chlamydia trachomatis, which is a common cause of non-gonococcal urethritis, and also treats Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the causative agent of gonococcal urethritis. The evidence paths confirm the causative role of these pathogens in urethritis. Other options like Cefepime, Metronidazole, and Clindamycin are less suitable as they do not effectively target both causative agents. Cefepime, although a broad-spectrum antibiotic, is not the first-line treatment for Chlamydia trachomatis. Metronidazole and Clindamycin are primarily effective against anaerobic bacteria and do not cover the pathogens responsible for gonococcal and non-gonococcal urethritis.
